[[[2024 will be organized at UNESCO Headquarters from 2 to 5 September 2024. The concept note is available online for your reference.

Recognized as one of the â€œUN Intergovernmental and Multi-Stakeholder Digital Cooperation Bodies and Forumsâ€,this annual event convenes the community of digital education leaders, policy-makers, researchers and practitioners from various organizations, including UN agencies, governments, NGOs, academia and the private sector.

Digital Learning Week 2024 aims to promote multi-stakeholder cooperation towards a human-centred and green design and use of AI in education, with a specific focus on exploring the interlinkages between digital transformation and greening education.

To surface best practices and facilitate knowledge sharing on the intersection of digital and green transformations, UNESCO is currently selecting presentations through a call for proposals. A separate call for presentations on the theme of AI and education is available here.

Selected presenters will have the unique opportunity to address a global audience comprising policy-makers, practitioners, researchers, private sector partners and development agencies.

Please note that UNESCO mainly seeks proposals pertaining to practices that have been implemented at scale, which means that conceptual ideas without practical implementation are not preferable.

The form below requests a narrative description of your presentations while personal information such as email addresses will not be shared. If your presentation is selected for inclusion in the programme, the description you provide will be used directly on the UNESCO website and other communication materials. Please allow yourself sufficient time to complete the required fields and ensure clarity and readability of the text. Only proposals in English or French will be considered.

Presentation proposals must be submitted to UNESCO no later than 5 June 2024. Selected proposals will be notified by 28 June 2024.

Please note that only selected submissions will be notified via email.

Each participant will be responsible for their own travel and accommodations to Digital Learning Week.

* Greening education is a communication term used to describe a holistic approach to educationâ€™s response to the climate crisis as demanded by young people. Greening education empowers learners with the knowledge, skills and attitudes needed to engage in transformative action on mitigation, adaptation and resilience to climate change, with the aim of shaping green, low emission climate-resilient societies.

Green technologies, also known as sustainable or eco-friendly technologies, are innovations aimed at reducing negative environmental impacts and promoting sustainability. These technologies are designed to minimize resource consumption, decrease pollution, and mitigate climate change (green design).

use this content betweeen 3 brackets [[[Title: GREEN LEARN: Greening Aspirations through Supporting Metacognition and Aspirational Re-appraisal Using Large Language Models

Narrative Description:

In my presentation, "GREEN LEARN: Greening Aspirations through Supporting Metacognition and Aspirational Re-appraisal Using Large Language Models (LLMs)," I will explore the transformative potential of LLMs in fostering a green, human-centered educational landscape. Drawing from my extensive experience with non-profits and social enterprises, I have gathered qualitative data on how these organizations perceive and utilize LLMs, often treating them as another type of software. This presentation will introduce a novel approach: integrating a system prompt designed to support goal reappraisal and promote metacognition, with the aim of nurturing a more ecologically mindful worldview.

The core of my talk will present a theory of ethics and a philosophical foundation based on prior research demonstrating that certain types of mindfulness and meditation practices are promoters of pro-environmental behaviors and actions. I will demonstrate how the reverse engineering of biomimetic technology allows us to craft system prompts that offer affordances to leverage wisdom gained through experience from the embedding space. By identifying how these affordances promote sustainability-oriented education for collective wellbeing, we can bypass the traditional "elite college -> elite consulting group -> green non-profit" pipeline.

To provide practical insights, I will discuss strategies that are currently under research and implementation, with results ready to present by October. These strategies include the development and implementation of white papers and recommendations for modifying the reinforcement learning components of LLMs. The goal is to create interfaces that incorporate affordances designed to promote metacognition, goal reappraisal, and ultimately foster an inner revolution conducive to a greener world.

This presentation will not only offer a conceptual framework but will also showcase practical applications and strategies that have been implemented at scale. Attendees will gain a comprehensive understanding of how to harness LLMs to support self-paced foundational skill acquisition, facilitate inquiry-based learning, and promote ecological consciousness among learners.

Objective:

The objective of this presentation is to share best practices and innovative approaches for integrating AI and LLMs into educational systems to foster metacognition, goal reappraisal, and ecological mindfulness. By highlighting practical implementations and providing actionable recommendations, this talk aims to inspire educators, policy-makers, and digital education leaders to adopt and scale these practices in their own contexts, contributing to a more sustainable and inclusive future.

This version integrates the emphasis on specific types of mindfulness and meditation practices and keeps the proposal aligned with UNESCO's goals for Digital Learning Week 2024.

Certainly! Here's a reformulated proposal focusing on the specified themes, incorporating relevant content and ensuring applicability to the UNESCO call for proposals:

---

**Title: ECO Learn: Enhancing AI Competencies and Integrity in Education**

**Narrative Description:**

In "ECO Learn: Enhancing AI Competencies and Integrity in Education," I will present a comprehensive approach to integrating AI in education with a focus on metacognition, ethical use, and sustainable practices. This proposal aligns with the themes of national or institutional AI competency frameworks, addressing challenges posed by AI, and innovative methodologies for training teachers.

Drawing from my extensive experience in educational technology, I will explore the development of AI competency frameworks for students and educators. These frameworks are designed to ensure that learners are equipped with the necessary skills to navigate and utilize AI responsibly. I will showcase best practices from various institutions where these frameworks have been implemented at scale, highlighting their impact on both student outcomes and institutional integrity.

One key area of focus will be strategies to address the challenges generative AI poses to academic integrity and learning assessment. I will discuss innovative solutions, such as AI-driven tools for plagiarism detection and the creation of unique, individualized assessments that are less susceptible to AI manipulation. These strategies not only uphold academic standards but also promote a deeper understanding and ethical use of AI among students.

In addition, I will present methodologies for training and assessing teachers' AI competencies. This includes the design and implementation of training programs and guidelines tested to support teaching and research staff in developing their AI skills. By incorporating elements of metacognition and goal reappraisal, these programs aim to foster a reflective and proactive approach to AI integration in the classroom.

**Objective:**

The objective of this presentation is to share best practices and innovative approaches for integrating AI into educational systems to enhance metacognition, ethical use, and sustainability. By highlighting practical implementations and providing actionable recommendations, this talk aims to inspire educators, policy-makers, and digital education leaders to adopt and scale these practices, contributing to a more inclusive and forward-thinking educational landscape.

---

This proposal aligns with UNESCO's goals for Digital Learning Week 2024 and focuses on practical, scalable implementations that address the critical areas of AI competency, academic integrity, and teacher training.
